name: Clonidine ER (Kapvay)
summary: An extended-release alpha-2 adrenergic agonist approved for ADHD in children and adolescents, also used for sleep disturbances and hyperarousal.
description: Clonidine ER (Kapvay) is an extended-release formulation of clonidine, a centrally acting alpha-2 adrenergic agonist. It reduces sympathetic nervous system activity, producing calming effects and improving attention in ADHD. The extended-release form allows for smoother plasma levels and reduced sedation compared to immediate-release clonidine. It is often used alone or in combination with stimulants, particularly when hyperactivity, impulsivity, or sleep disturbances are prominent.

items: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) in children and adolescents aged 6–17 years
Sleep disturbances in children with ADHD (off-label)

sections.text: Stimulates alpha-2 adrenergic receptors in the brainstem, decreasing sympathetic outflow and producing sedation, reduced hyperactivity, and improved impulse control.

pediatric.titrate: Increase by 0.1 mg/day at weekly intervals as tolerated

sections.adult: Not FDA-approved for adults, but used off-label with similar dosing to pediatric upper ranges
sections.geriatric: Use caution due to risk of hypotension and sedation

sections.text: Onset of behavioral effects typically within 1–2 weeks; duration of action approximately 12–24 hours depending on dose.

other: Avoid abrupt discontinuation to prevent rebound hypertension
Monitor for additive CNS depression with sedatives
May exacerbate depression in susceptible individuals

items: Blood pressure and heart rate at baseline and periodically
Signs of rebound hypertension if discontinued

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if benefits outweigh potential risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation
sections.geriatrics: Caution due to increased risk of hypotension

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over 3–7 days to minimize rebound hypertension risk.

items: Often used as adjunct to stimulant therapy in ADHD
Can improve sleep onset and reduce evening hyperactivity
Extended-release formulation provides more stable plasma concentrations compared to immediate-release clonidine
